intro: Crossoglossa tillettii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with a distinctive throat coloration. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to prevent leaf scorching. Crossoglossa tillettii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
